etymologies: Old English tǣsl, tǣsel, of West Germanic origin; related to tease

definitions: a tall prickly Eurasian plant with spiny purple flower heads.

notes.text: Genus Dipsacus, family Dipsacaceae: several species, including fuller's teasel

shortDefinitions: tall prickly Eurasian plant with spiny purple flower heads

definitions: a large, dried, spiny head from a teasel plant, or a device serving as a substitute for one of these, used in the textile industry to raise a nap on woven cloth.
shortDefinitions: large dried head from teasel, or device serving as substitute for one of these

definitions: raise a nap on (cloth) with or as if with teasels

examples.text: if a soft nap is desired, the cloth must be teaseled
there was an increase in cloth-finishing, especially by teaseling

shortDefinitions: raise nap on cloth with or as if with teasels
